thread.title: To do this weekend: Wine Riot, Chili Fest Chicago -
thread.title_full: To do this weekend: Wine Riot, Chili Fest Chicago - Chicago Tribune

author: Lindsey Compton
title: To do this weekend: Wine Riot, Chili Fest Chicago -
text:
Wine and chili warm up the weekend of Oct. 16-18:
DO MORE!
Calling all wine fanatics: At Chicago's Wine Riot 2015, taste more than 250 wines from all over the world when dozens of winemakers set up camp in the Great Hall at Union Station, ready to pour you a glass and chat about their grapes. Sections will be themed by wine regions and grape types, so you can easily try familiar favorites or explore something new. Throughout the day or evening, pop into wine-tasting courses. Friday, Oct. 16, 7-11 p.m., and Saturday, Oct. 17, 1-5 p.m. and 7-11 p.m. at Union Station, 500 W. Jackson Blvd. $60 per session at www.secondglass.com .
SPEND LESS!
Stay warm with a few hearty helpings of chili at this year's Chili Fest Chicago. For just $10, sample five chilis from restaurants including Dia De Los Tamales, Lindy's Chili, Chicago's Dog House and Municipal Bar at this parking lot party, where the vibe screams tailgate, but better food. Saturday, Oct. 17, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m., and Sunday, Oct. 18, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. at 218 W. Ohio St., www.hastickets.com/ChiliFestChicago .
Privacy Policy Dining and Drinking Entertainment
